sentences.sContent: The candle flickered in the wind.
The candle flickered and then went out.
sentences.sContent_eng: The candle flickered and then went out.
sentences.sCn: 一开始蜡烛摇曳不定， 然后就灭了。

sentences.sContent: When the candle was only half an inch high it flickered out and the room became dark.
sentences.sContent_eng: When the candle was only half an inch high it flickered out and the room became dark.
sentences.sCn: 蜡烛只有半英寸长时，烛光忽闪忽闪地熄灭了，于是房间一片漆黑。

phrases.pCn: [常用于否定句或疑问句]值得，合算，划得来
n. [物理]烛光（国际单位制中的照明单位）

trans.tranOther: a stick of  wax  with a string through the middle, which you burn to give light
